cyclone.name: NESTOR
cyclone.current_location: about 85 miles southwest of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Accelerating northeast across the Florida Panhandle today, then across the southeastern states and turning east-northeast, moving offshore the North Carolina coast late Sunday and then seaward just south of the Delmarva/New Jersey coast on Monday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Panhandle near/just east of Panama City – Apalachicola area

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect north of Florida
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings Navarre FL to Yankeetown FL; Storm-surge warnings Indian Pass FL to Clearwater Beach FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Panhandle, northern & central Florida, Georgia and the Carolinas, then offshore of the Mid-Atlantic (including waters east of New Jersey)
weather_observation.34kt_max: ≈4 % (value at Norfolk – Philadelphia would be lower)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusty northeast winds Monday (25–35 mph) as the post-tropical center passes offshore
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in the Delaware River; minor tidal fluctuation possible along the New Jersey coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of moderate rain Monday could total 1–3 inches, briefly reducing visibilities and causing slick pier surfaces
weather_observation.other_hazards: Minor river or urban ponding, possible brief logistical delays to truck/rail transfer operations
